title: Families crossing U.S. border illegally reached all-time high in August
description: At least 91,000 migrants crossing in a family group were arrested in August, an influx that may return immigration to the spotlight for the 2024 election.

title: Amid record heat, even indoor factory workers enter dangerous terrain
description: Record-setting temperatures, coupled with humidity, are pushing communities to the brink, experts say.

title: China infuriates India with new map, upsetting chances of thaw in relations
description: India has lodged a diplomatic protest because the Chinese map, released annually by the government, shows a state in India’s far northeast as part of China.

title: Japanese ministers eat Fukushima sashimi to show water release is safe
description: Japan is trying to dispel concerns about treated wastewater from the Fukushima nuclear plant and counter uproar in China, which banned Japanese seafood imports.

title: U.S. presses Saudi Arabia on reported migrant massacres
description: The alleged killing of hundreds or possibly thousands of civilians by Saudi forces along the Yemen border raises concerns about U.S. military aid to Riyadh.

title: Embattled Chinese property developer Country Garden at risk of default
description: Country Garden reported a loss of almost $7 billion for the first half of the year, deepening China’s real estate crisis — and imperiling the broader economy.

title: For George Santos, a life in Brazil at odds with his GOP politics
description: As a young adult in his mother’s native land, family, friends and acquaintances say, the embattled congressman performed in drag and marched for Pride – activities that put him in opposition to current Republican policies and rhetoric.

title: When 5 million bees escaped from a truck, beekeepers swarmed to help
description: About 5 million bees escaped when a truck carrying them lost control. Ontario police asked beekeepers to help to control them.

title: In the Gulf, a growing scramble for Ozempic and other weight-loss drugs
description: A new class of weight loss drugs are surging in popularity in the oil-rich Persian Gulf, leading to shortages and calls for greater regulation.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Russia and North Korea ‘actively advancing’ arms negotiations, U.S. says
description: The U.S. ambassador to the United Nations, Linda Thomas-Greenfield, said Russia discussed buying “significant quantities” of munitions to use against Ukraine.

title: U.S. Embassy in Haiti tells Americans to leave ‘as soon as possible’
description: The embassy in the Haitian capital of Port-au-Prince urged U.S. citizens to evacuate amid widespread gang violence and unrest, adding that flights are limited.

title: Johannesburg apartment fire kills at least 63, say South African officials
description: The city’s emergency services spokesman Robert Mulaudzi said at least 43 people had also been injured in the blaze and that a search and recovery operation was underway.

title: Rural areas sacrificed for Xi Jinping’s new city, satellite imagery shows
description: Satellite imagery and firsthand accounts show the damage wrought when Chinese authorities opened floodgates and dams this month, sacrificing whole villages to spare politically important cities.

title: India’s moon landing sets the tone for a new type of space race
description: The fates met by two small robots on the surface of the moon tell the stories of shifting international politics on their planet of origin.
